Description: Mould-made pottery `Frog Type' lamp with a deep body and a stub-handle at the rear. The top has a raised rim around the deep-sunk filling-hole area, with the head of a frog extending from it; below the rim are scroll patterns. On each side of the nozzle is an impressed circle. On the undefined base are two impressed palm-branches and a groove on a base-line, with a crescent above.
Bibliographic references: Lamp / Catalogue of the Lamps in the British Museum (Q2141)
Acquisition name: Donated by: Wellcome Institute for the History of Medicine (trustees)
Previous owner: Previous owner/ex-collection: Sir Henry Solomon Wellcome
